alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 3:26PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 615 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated a band of showers moving onshore the San Diego coast with the heaviest showers focused south of Encinitas. Rainfall amounts of a quarter to a half an inch per hour will occur in the heaviest showers. Minor urban flooding is possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Carlsbad, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Imperial Beach, Coronado, Del Mar, Mission Valley, Linda Vista, North Park, Hillcrest, Tierrasanta, Midway District Including Lindbergh Field, University City, Downtown San Diego, Mission Beach, La Jolla and Point Loma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
